newsitem.title: HUNGARY: GE Hungary unit to invest $40-50 mln in '97.
newsitem.headline: GE Hungary unit to invest $40-50 mln in '97.

text.p: Hungarian lighting company GE Lighting Tungsram Rt, a unit of the U.S. GE group, said on Thursday that it planned to invest $40 to $50 million in 1997 in Hungary.
"That's about the same amount than in the past few years," Tungsram vice president Peter Wohl told Reuters. "A substantial part will be spent on increasing production capacity."
Wohl added that up to 50 percent of the amount would finance the instalment of new production equipment and Tungsram would also spend on automation and environmental protection.
Wohl said GE has invested $650 million in Tungsram, which was founded 100 years ago, since the U.S. giant purchased the Hungarian company in 1989.
Wohl declined to disclose preliminary Tungsram figures for this year, saying that GE's business policy does not allow that.
He said recently that Tungsram's 1996 net sales were likely to considerably exceed last year's 50 billion forints.
